flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500.0>>500.0 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500.0*$.0.25=$152.0<<500.0*0.25=152.0>>152.0 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500.0*$.0.5=$250.0<<500.0*0.5=250.0>>250.0 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $152.0+$250.0=$402.0<<152.0+250.0=402.0>>402.0 total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 125.0, not 152.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
